title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises against discussing playoffs, urging focus on current games instead of postseason strategies.
Red Sox hold second AL wild-card spot, 1.5 games behind Yankees, with Rangers three games back in wild-card race.
Red Sox face challenging schedule with two playoff-bound opponents ahead, while Rangers face one series against playoff contenders.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow is prioritizing hiring a general manager as a second-in-command for the offseason.
The Red Sox have not had a GM since Breslow's hiring, reflecting a recent trend of decreased GM influence.
Assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni are potential GM candidates.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick, giving up a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a 2024 second-round draft pick, underperformed with 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns as a rookie.
Polk was placed on injured reserve after a preseason shoulder injury, ending his 2025 season prematurely.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots aim to end a five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami, facing a historically tough matchup.
Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated against the Patriots, winning all seven of his career starts.
Miami's defense, after trading Jalen Ramsey, faces challenges but features strong pass rushers like Bradley Chubb and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic-themed concert at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025.
The setlist featured tracks from Cain's album 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You', exploring themes of first love and heartbreak.
The performance included a surprise collaboration with Jae Matthews, creating an immersive and emotional audience experience.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior', depicting a 59-year-old's return to college football.
Chiklis, an Andover High alum, reconnects with his former football teammates at a Boston screening event.
'The Senior' premieres nationwide on September 19, showcasing a true redemption story of determination and regret.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are featured on Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans.
Abigail Johnson, with a net worth of $35 billion, is Massachusetts' wealthiest person.
Robert Kraft, Patriots owner, ranks as the third wealthiest in Massachusetts with $13.8 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees in their series opener at Fenway Park.
Boston's offense managed only two hits, with key players Roman Anthony and Wilyer Abreu absent.
Red Sox committed three errors, contributing to a lackluster performance against their rivals.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during a game against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, was attempting to block an extra point when multiple players collided with his leg.
Wise joined the Washington Commanders on a one-year, $3.25 million contract after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early impressed in his MLB debut, striking out 11 batters over five scoreless innings for the Red Sox.
Manager Alex Cora suggests Early might start Tuesday against the Athletics, amidst a reshuffling of Boston's rotation.
Boston is assessing pitching options, with young prospects Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison also considered for starting roles.
